name: Anthurium radicans
description: Anthurium radicans is a climbing or trailing epiphytic aroid native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly Costa Rica, Panama, and Colombia. It belongs to the Araceae family and features heart-shaped to oval, dark green leaves (10-20 cm long) with prominent white or silver veins. The plant displays a climbing or trailing growth habit and can reach lengths of 60-120 cm. It produces small, white to cream-colored spathes. In its native habitat, it grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks and branches in tropical forests, often climbing. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds unique interest with its trailing or climbing habit. It's popular among aroid enthusiasts for its attractive foliage and vining form.
